questions.text: What is the primary purpose of Tailwind CSS?

options.text: To provide a framework for creating animations
To offer utility-first classes for rapid UI development
To replace JavaScript for frontend interactivity

questions.explanation: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first framework that provides pre-defined classes for rapid and consistent UI development.

questions.text: What class would you use to apply padding of 4 units in Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: In Tailwind CSS, the `p-4` class applies padding on all sides with a size of 4 units.

questions.text: Which class is used to make an element flex container in Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: The `flex` class is used to make an element a flex container in Tailwind CSS.

questions.text: How do you apply a background color of blue with 500 intensity in Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: The `bg-blue-500` class applies a background color of blue with intensity 500.

questions.text: What does the `hover:bg-red-500` class do in Tailwind CSS?

options.text: Changes the background to red on hover
Changes the text color to red on hover
Sets the default background to red
Sets the border color to red on hover

questions.explanation: The `hover:bg-red-500` class changes the background color to red when the element is hovered.

questions.text: How can you center a block element horizontally in Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: The `mx-auto` class centers a block element horizontally by setting `margin-left` and `margin-right` to `auto`.

questions.text: Which class would you use to make text bold in Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: The `font-bold` class makes text bold in Tailwind CSS.

questions.text: How do you control the z-index of an element in Tailwind CSS?
questions.explanation: In Tailwind CSS, z-index is controlled with classes like `z-10`, `z-20`, etc.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the `group` class in Tailwind CSS?

options.text: To group multiple elements together in a grid
To enable nested states like group-hover
To apply styles to all child elements

questions.explanation: The `group` class allows applying styles to child elements based on the parent’s state, such as `group-hover`.

questions.text: How can you extend Tailwind CSS's default spacing scale?

options.text: By modifying the spacing section in tailwind.config.js

questions.explanation: You can extend the spacing scale in Tailwind by modifying the `spacing` section in `tailwind.config.js`.
